                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <li>Risk analysis</li>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | </ul>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>&nbsp;</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>The post <a rel="nofollow" href="http://linux-audit.com/5-basic-principles-of-linux-system-security/">5 Basic Principles of Linux System Security</a> appeared first on <a rel="nofollow" href="http://linux-audit.com">Linux Audit</a>.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | 
 206094 | 2015-11-02 18:15:13 | Science    | Engineers design magnetic cell sensors                                                                         | http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/11/151102131513.htm                                                                                          |                   | 2015-11-22 20:02:57.141914 |                                                                                                                                                    | Engineers have designed magnetic protein nanoparticles that can be used to track cells or to monitor interactions within cells. The new "hypermagnetic" protein nanoparticles can be produced within cells, allowing the cells to be imaged or sorted using magnetic techniques. This eliminates the need to tag cells with synthetic particles and allows the particles to sense other molecules inside cells, say the researchers. 
 206227 | 2015-11-03 13:00:03 | Science    | NASA finds new way to track ocean currents from space                                                          | http://phys.org/news/2015-11-nasa-track-ocean-currents-space.html                                                                                      |                   | 2015-11-04 13:17:16.588808 | earth sciences                                                                                                                                     | A team of NASA and university scientists has developed a new way to use satellite measurements to track changes in Atlantic Ocean currents, which are a driving force in global climate. The finding opens a path to better monitoring and understanding of how ocean circulation is changing and what the changes may mean for future climate.
 206330 | 2015-11-03 15:26:52 | Astronomy  | First Evidence of Neutrinos --The 'Ghostly' Building Block of the Universe                                     | http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2015/11/first-evidence-of-neutrinos-the-ghostly-building-block-of-the-universe.html                               | dailygalaxy.com   | 2015-11-23 13:45:07.885478 |                                                                                                                                                    | <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><p> </p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p> </p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p><a class="asset-img-link" href="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/.a/6a00d8341bf7f753ef01b7c7e6f12c970b-pi" style="display: inline;"><img alt="Firstevidenc" border="0" class="asset  asset-image at-xid-6a00d8341bf7f753ef01b7c7e6f12c970b image-full img-responsive" src="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/.a/6a00d8341bf7f753ef01b7c7e6f12c970b-800wi" title="Firstevidenc"></img></a></p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p> </p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>Major international collaboration has seen its first neutrinos – so-called ‘ghost particles,' subatomic, almost massless high-energy  particles that only interact via gravity or nuclear decay, generated in cosmic accelerators: black holes, massive exploding stars and the energetic cores of galaxies.Because they don’t interact with light, they can’t be seen. Neutrinos carry no electric charge and travel through the universe almost entirely unaffected by natural forces. They are considered a fundamental building block of matter. The 2015 Nobel Prize in physics was awarded for neutrino oscillations, a phenomenon that is of great important to the field of elementary particle physics.</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | An international team of scientists at the MicroBooNE physics experiment in the US, including researchers from the University of Cambridge, detected their first neutrino candidates. It represents a milestone for the project, involving years of hard work and a 40-foot-long particle detector that is filled with 170 tons of liquid argon.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>“It’s nine years since we proposed, designed, built, assembled and commissioned this experiment,” said Bonnie Fleming, MicroBooNE co-spokesperson and a professor of physics at Yale University. “That kind of investment makes seeing first neutrinos incredible.”</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>Following a 13-week shutdown for maintenance, <a class="zem_slink" href="http://maps.google.com/maps?ll=41.8319444444,-88.2572222222&amp;spn=0.01,0.01&amp;q=41.8319444444,-88.2572222222 (Fermilab)&amp;t=h" rel="geolocation" target="_blank" title="Fermilab">Fermilab</a>’s accelerator complex near Chicago delivered a proton beam on Thursday, which is used to make the neutrinos, to the laboratory’s experiments. After the beam was turned on, scientists analysed the data recorded by MicroBooNE’s particle detector to find evidence of its first neutrino interactions.</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>Scientists at the University of Cambridge have been working on advanced image reconstruction techniques that contributed to the ability to identify the rare neutrino interactions in the MicroBooNE data.</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>The MicroBooNE experiment aims to study how neutrinos interact and change within a distance of 500 meters. The detector will help scientists reconstruct the results of neutrino collisions as finely detailed, three-dimensional images. MicroBooNE findings also will be relevant for the forthcoming Deep Underground <a class="zem_slink" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cowan%E2%80%93Reines_neutrino_experiment" rel="wikipedia" target="_blank" title="Cowan–Reines neutrino experiment">Neutrino Experiment</a> (DUNE), which will examine neutrino transitions over longer distances.</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>“Future neutrino experiments will use this technology,” said Sam Zeller, Fermilab physicist and MicroBooNE co-spokesperson. “We’re learning a lot from this detector. It’s important not just for us, but for the whole physics community.”</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>“This is an important step towards the much larger Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE)”, said Professor Mark Thomson of Cambridge’s <a class="zem_slink" href="http://maps.google.com/maps?ll=52.2092638889,0.0920111111111&amp;spn=0.01,0.01&amp;q=52.2092638889,0.0920111111111 (Cavendish%20Laboratory)&amp;t=h" rel="geolocation" target="_blank" title="Cavendish Laboratory">Cavendish Laboratory</a>, co-spokesperson of the DUNE collaboration and member of MicroBooNE. “It is the first time that fully automated pattern recognition software has been used to identify neutrino interactions from the complex images in a detector such as MicroBooNE and the proposed DUNE detector.”</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>The Daily Galaxy via University of Cambridge</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>Image Credit: MicroBooNE</p>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <fieldset class="zemanta-related"><legend class="zemanta-related-title">Related articles</legend>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <div class="zemanta-article-ul zemanta-article-ul-image" style="margin: 0; padding: 0; overflow: hidden;">\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <div class="zemanta-article-ul-li-image zemanta-article-ul-li" style="padding: 0; background: none; list-style: none; display: block; float: left; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 84px; font-size: 11px; margin: 2px 10px 10px 2px;"><a href="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2015/05/csi-the-death-of-a-galaxy.html" style="box-shadow: 0px 0px 4px #999; width: 80px; max-width: 100%;"></img></a><a href="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2015/05/csi-the-death-of-a-galaxy.html" style="display: block; overflow: hidden; text-decoration: none; line-height: 12pt; height: 80px; padding: 5px 2px 0 2px;" target="_blank">"CSI" --The Death of a Galaxy</a></div>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <div class="zemanta-article-ul-li-image zemanta-article-ul-li" style="padding: 0; background: none; list-style: none; display: block; float: left; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 84px; font-size: 11px; margin: 2px 10px 10px 2px;"><a href="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2015/05/mystery-atmosphere-of-the-alien-diamond-planet.html" style="box-shadow: 0px 0px 4px #999; width: 80px; max-width: 100%;"></img></a><a href="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2015/05/mystery-atmosphere-of-the-alien-diamond-planet.html" style="display: block; overflow: hidden; text-decoration: none; line-height: 12pt; height: 80px; padding: 5px 2px 0 2px;" target="_blank">Strange Alien Atmosphere of the "Diamond Planet"</a></div>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <div class="zemanta-article-ul-li-image zemanta-article-ul-li" style="padding: 0; background: none; list-style: none; display: block; float: left; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 84px; font-size: 11px; margin: 2px 10px 10px 2px;"><a href="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2015/01/peering-back-13-billion-years-to-view-quasars-powered-by-supermassive-black-holes.html" style="box-shadow: 0px 0px 4px #999; padding: 2px; display: block; border-radius: 2px; text-decoration: none;" target="_blank"><img alt="" src="http://i.zemanta.com/322558187_80_80.jpg" style="padding: 0; margin: 0; border: 0; display: block; width: 80px; max-width: 100%;"></img></a><a href="http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2015/01/peering-back-13-billion-years-to-view-quasars-powered-by-supermassive-black-holes.html" style="display: block; overflow: hidden; text-decoration: none; line-height: 12pt; height: 80px; padding: 5px 2px 0 2px;" target="_blank">Peering Back 13-Billion Years to Glimpse Quasars Powered by Supermassive Black Holes</a></div>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | </div>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | </fieldset></div><div class="feedflare">                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/TheDailyGalaxyNewsFromPlanetEarthBeyond?a=fpZ8isv5RDg:ldMJiOKjbd0:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/TheDailyGalaxyNewsFromPlanetEarthBeyond?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a>
