        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | </div>\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | </fieldset></div><div class="feedflare">                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <a href="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/TheDailyGalaxyNewsFromPlanetEarthBeyond?a=GN-brgW6iUQ:wUEaPZSTRWk:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/TheDailyGalaxyNewsFromPlanetEarthBeyond?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | </div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/TheDailyGalaxyNewsFromPlanetEarthBeyond/~4/GN-brgW6iUQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/>
 211660 | 2015-11-13 15:59:24 | Science    | The dinosaur ankle re-evolved amphibian-like development in birds                                              | http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/11/151113105924.htm                                                                                          |                   | 2015-11-17 15:44:30.911552 |                                                                                                                                                    | In the 19th century, Darwin's most vocal scientific advocate was Thomas Henry Huxley, who is also remembered as a pioneer of the hypotheses that birds are living dinosaurs. He noticed several similarities of the skeleton of living birds and extinct dinosaurs, among them, a pointed portion of the anklebone projecting upwards onto the shank bone (aka drumstick). This "ascending process" is well known to specialists as a unique trait of dinosaurs. However, until the late 20th century, many scientists were doubtful about the dinosaur-bird link. Some pointed out that the ascending process in most birds was a projection of the neighbouring heel bone, rather than the anklebone. If so, it would not be comparable, and would not support the dinosaur-bird link.  
 211801 | 2015-11-16 07:30:50 | Philosophy | What Higher Consciousness Really Means, How We Attain It, and What It Does for the Human Spirit                | https://www.brainpickings.org/2015/11/16/school-of-life-higher-consciousness/                                                                          | Maria Popova      | 2015-11-23 16:04:27.68996  | culture,psychology,alain de botton,film,philosophy,school of life                                                                                  | <h3>&#8220;At such moments, the world reveals itself as quite different: a place of suffering and misguided effort &#8230; but also a place of tenderness and longing, beauty, and touching vulnerability. &#8220;</h3>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <hr>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p><em>&#8220;[Leonardo da Vinci&#8217;s] unique brain wiring &#8230; allowed him the opportunity to experience the world from the vantage point of a higher dimension,&#8221;</em> Leonard Shlain wrote in his <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2014/11/17/leonardos-brain-leonard-shlain/">stimulating inquiry into the source of Leonardo&#8217;s genius</a>. But what is &#8220;higher consciousness,&#8221; really, and can it be unmoored from the baggage of spiritualism and superstition to enrich our secular understanding of what it means to be human?</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p><img src="https://i1.wp.com/www.brainpickings.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/higherconscioiusness1.jpg?resize=680%2C357" alt="higherconscioiusness" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-50846" data-recalc-dims="1" /></p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>Few contemporary thinkers have done more to reinstate philosophy as a guiding light for public life and a practical tool for personal growth than philosopher and <a href="http://www.theschooloflife.com/" target="_blank">School of Life</a> founder <strong>Alain de Botton</strong>, who has written beautifully about such enduring ideas as <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2013/10/25/art-as-therapy-alain-de-botton-john-armstrong/">the role of art in human happiness</a> and <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2014/10/15/nietzsche-on-difficulty/">what Nietzsche teaches us about the character-building role of difficulty</a>. De Botton&#8217;s fantastic recent <a href="http://fourhourworkweek.com/2015/11/10/alain-de-botton/" target="_blank">conversation with Tim Ferriss</a> pointed me to this equally fantastic video essay examining the question of higher consciousness.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p><iframe width="680" height="383" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vqCOss4hqnE?rel=0&amp;controls=0&amp;showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe></p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <blockquote><p>As human beings, we spend most of our lives functioning in states of lower consciousness, where what we are principally concerned with is ourselves, our survival and our own success, narrowly defined.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>Ordinary life rewards practical, unintrospective, self-justifying outlooks that are the hallmarks of what we could call &#8220;lower&#8221; consciousness. Neuroscientists speak of a &#8220;lower&#8221; part of the brain they term the reptilian mind and tell us that under its sway, we strike back when we’re hit, blame others, quell any stray questions that lack immediate relevance, fail to free-associate, and stick closely to a flattering image of who we are and where we are heading.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>However, at rare moments, when there are no threats or demands upon us, perhaps late at night or early in the morning, when our bodies and passions are comfortable and quiescent, we have the privilege of being able to access the higher mind &#8212; what neuroscientists call our neocortex, the seat of imagination, empathy and impartial judgement. We loosen our hold on our own egos and ascend to a less biased and more universal perspective, casting off a little of the customary anxious self-justification and brittle pride.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>In such states, the mind moves beyond its particular self-interests and cravings. We start to think of other people in a more imaginative way. Rather than criticize and attack, we are free to imagine that their behavior is driven by pressures derived from their own more primitive minds, which they are generally in no position to tell us about. Their temper or viciousness are, we now see, symptoms of hurt rather than of &#8220;evil.&#8221;</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>It’s an astonishing gradual evolution to develop the ability to explain others’ actions by their distress, rather than simply in terms of how it affects us. We perceive that the appropriate response to humanity is not fear, cynicism or aggression, but always &#8212; when we can manage it &#8212; love. At such moments, the world reveals itself as quite different: a place of suffering and misguided effort, full of people striving to be heard and lashing out against others, but also a place of tenderness and longing, beauty, and touching vulnerability. </p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>The fitting response is universal sympathy and kindness.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>[&#8230;]</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>States of higher consciousness are, of course, desperately short lived. We shouldn’t in any case aspire to make them permanent, because they don’t sit so well with the many important practical tasks we all need to attend to. But we should make the most of them when they arise, and harvest their insights for the time when we require them most. Higher consciousness is a huge triumph over the primitive mind which cannot envisage any such possibilities. Ideally, we would be a little more alive to the advantages of this higher mind and strive to make our oceanic experiences somewhat less random and less clothed in unnecessary mystery.</p></blockquote>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>The film is part of the excellent <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7IcJI8PUf5Z3zKxnZvTBog" target="_blank">School of Life series</a> that has previously examined <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2014/10/09/school-of-life-literature-reading/">what great books do for the soul</a>, <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2015/06/26/proust-school-of-life-art/">how to stop letting habit blunt our aliveness</a>, <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2014/10/24/what-is-philosophy-for-alain-de-botton/">what philosophy is for</a>, <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2015/01/20/school-of-life-fulfilling-work/">how to find fulfilling work</a>, and <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/2015/02/25/school-of-life-religion/">what comes after religion</a>.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <hr /><h3>donating = loving</h3><p class="flipboard-keep">Bringing you (ad-free) Brain Pickings takes me hundreds of hours each month. If you find any joy and stimulation here, please consider becoming a Supporting Member with a recurring monthly <a href="https://www.brainpickings.org/donate/">donation</a> of your choosing, between a cup of tea and a good dinner.</p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    |         |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <hr />         |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |         |                     |            |                                                                                                                |         |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | <p>Brain Pickings has a free weekly newsletter. It comes out on Sundays and offers the week’s most unmissable reads. Here’s <a href="http://us2.campaign-archive1.com/?u=13eb080d8a315477042e0d5b1&id=de29ba37e7&e=b2dbad0745">what to expect</a>.  212727 | 2015-11-17 17:06:45 | Science    | Spooky Action Is Real: Bizarre Quantum Entanglement Confirmed in New Tests                                     | http://www.livescience.com/52811-spooky-action-is-real.html                                                                                            |                   | 2015-11-23 13:22:50.181435 |                                                                                                                                                    | Spooky action at a distance, the bizarre implication of quantum mechanics that so-rattled Einstein, is real, a series of new tests confirm.
 213125 | 2015-11-18 13:33:47 | Science    | Powerful jets from non-spinning black holes                                                                    | http://phys.org/news/2015-11-powerful-jets-non-spinning-black-holes.html                                                                               |                   | 2015-11-22 20:16:40.461143 | astronomy                                                                                                                                          | A black hole is so simple (at least in traditional theories) that it can be completely described by just three parameters: its mass, its spin, and its electric charge. Even though it may have formed out of a complex mix of matter and energy, all the other specific details are lost when it collapses to a singular point. The environment of a black hole is not so simple, however. As material flows in towards the black hole, a hot accretion disk develops. In galaxies with active black hole nuclei, the disks facilitate the production of powerful jets of ionized matter. In some cases the jet particles are driven to velocities close to the speed of light. These jets are thought to be powered by the rotational energy of the spinning black hole, with magnetic fields playing a pivotal role.
 213731 | 2015-11-19 05:00:00 | Technology | Particle accelerator on a microchip                                                                            | http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2015-11/ded-pao111915.php                                                                                       |                   | 2015-12-21 17:10:42.414927 |                                                                                                                                                    | (<i>Deutsches Elektronen-Synchrotron DESY</i>) The Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation has awarded $13.5 million (&euro;12.6 million) to promote the development of a particle accelerator on a microchip. DESY and the University of Hamburg are among the partners involved in this international project, headed by Robert Byer of Stanford University and Peter Hommelhoff of the University of Erlangen-Nürnberg. Within five years, they hope to produce a working prototype of an 'accelerator-on-a-chip'.
 213987 | 2015-11-19 18:29:00 | Astronomy  | New satellite to measure plant health                                                                          | http://www.esa.int/Our_Activities/Observing_the_Earth/New_satellite_to_measure_plant_health                                                            |                   | 2015-11-23 15:42:02.297199 |                                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    |                                                                 <img src="http://www.esa.int/var/esa/storage/images/esa_multimedia/images/2014/11/flex_concept/15684038-1-eng-GB/FLEX_concept_small.jpg" width="170" height="96" align="left" hspace="8" /><br />                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    |                 <p>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | ESA plans to track the health of the world’s vegetation by detecting and measuring the faint glow that plants give off as they convert sunlight and the atmosphere’s carbon dioxide into energy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       +
        |                     |            |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                        |                   |                            |                                                                                                                                                    | </p>
